title: 105_s1408
content: TITLE I--LOWER EAST SIDE TENEMENT NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE, NEW YORK. SEC. 101. FINDINGS AND PURPOSES. Congress finds that immigration and cultural diversity are key factors in defining the identity of the United States. The late 19th and early 20th centuries saw a significant influx of immigrants, with the Lower East Side neighborhood in Manhattan absorbing a large number of immigrants. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City is a notable survivor of the buildings that housed immigrants during this period. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City is a museum dedicated to interpreting immigrant life in the neighborhood. It was declared a National Historic Landmark in 1994. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City is suitable for inclusion in the National Park System to preserve and interpret themes of immigration, tenement life, housing reform, and architecture. The purposes include ensuring the interpretation of the immigrant phenomenon in the Lower East Side and enhancing the interpretation of other national monuments. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City is designated as a national historic site by section 103. The Lower East Side Tenement Museum, a nonprofit organization, owns and operates the building at 97 Orchard Street. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City is designated as a national historic site and affiliated with the National Park System. The Secretary coordinates its operation and interpretation with other national monuments. The Lower East Side Tenement at 97 Orchard Street in New York City, a national historic site, is owned and managed by the Museum, with a focus on the immigrant experience in the United States. SEC. 104. MANAGEMENT OF THE HISTORIC SITE. The Secretary may enter into a cooperative agreement with the Museum for marking, interpreting, and preserving the national historic site. Technical and financial assistance can be provided for preservation efforts, including capital improvements. A general management plan will be developed in consultation with the Museum to define the Secretary's role in interpretation and preservation, integrating with national monuments like the Statue of Liberty. The plan for the historic site will be integrated with other National Monuments. The completion of the plan is required within 2 years. The Secretary is not authorized to acquire the property at 97 Orchard Street or assume financial responsibility for the site's operation. SEC. 105. Authorization of appropriations for this title. TITLE II - SEC. 201. Casa Malpais National Historic Landmark in Arizona. The Casa Malpais National Historic Landmark in Arizona, one of the largest Mogollon communities in the US, includes a 58-room pueblo, Great Kiva complex, and catacomb chambers. Designated in 1964, efforts are underway for interpretation and preservation. The purpose is to benefit the public through preservation and interpretation. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to enter into cooperative agreements with the State of Arizona and the town of Springerville, Arizona for technical and financial assistance in operating and maintaining the Casa Malpais National Historic Landmark. The agreements may also include provisions for access to all public portions of the property. The Secretary of the Interior can make agreements with Arizona and Springerville for Casa Malpais National Historic Landmark maintenance. Access to the property must be allowed, and changes to the landmark need mutual agreement. Appropriations are available for financial assistance. In Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, improvements to Alger County Road H-58 are included. Improvements to Alger County Road H-58 are included in the Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. A new subsection prohibits the construction of a scenic shoreline drive in the area. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
